alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 11:22PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Moderate rain from Thursday through Saturday morning led to rises on the Little Popo Agie and Little Wind Rivers. There is a chance overnight into early Sunday morning for brief heavy rain, but widespread heavy rainfall is not expected. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...the Little Popo Agie and Little Wind Rivers, east of Hudson to areas just south of Riverton. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated, leading to minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1113 PM MDT, At 7.0 feet, Bankfull stage. At 8.0 feet, Flood stage. - At 11 PM MDT, Saturday June 3, water levels on the Little Wind River were at 7 feet and holding steady. Gauge reports between Riverton and Lander measured between 1 and 1.25 inches of rain since Thursday. This will cause small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... St Stephens. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
